causes.cause: NAD27 data not transformed to NAD83
causes.description: Legacy NAD27 data requires NADCON transformation to NAD83
indicators: Data source mentions NAD27 or NGVD29

causes.description: Simple Helmert transformation used instead of NADCON grids
indicators: Transformation was applied but offset remains

solutions.forCause: NAD27 data not transformed to NAD83
steps: Identify the original datum (NAD27 or NAD83)
Use NGS NADCON tool or equivalent software
Apply grid-based transformation
Validate against known control points
solutions.prevention: Always document datum information with spatial data

steps: Revert to original coordinates if possible
Apply correct NADCON grid transformation
Document transformation method used
solutions.prevention: Use authoritative transformation tools like NGS NADCON

causes.cause: Mixing US Survey Feet and International Feet
causes.description: Some SPCS zones use US Survey Feet (exact 1200/3937 m), others use International Feet (0.3048 m)
indicators: Data from different sources don't align
Offset increases with distance from origin

causes.description: One dataset in feet, another in meters
indicators: Values seem very large or small

solutions.forCause: Mixing US Survey Feet and International Feet
steps: Identify the foot definition for each dataset
Convert to a common unit (preferably meters)
Use the conversion factor: 1 US Survey Foot = 1200/3937 meters
solutions.prevention: Always document linear units with coordinate data

steps: Identify unit for each dataset
Convert all data to meters
1 foot = 0.3048 meters (international) or 1200/3937 meters (US survey)
solutions.prevention: Standardize on meters for data storage and exchange

symptoms.description: Distortion increases toward edge of study area

causes.description: State Plane zones have limited extent for accuracy

steps: Identify all zones involved
Consider using UTM zones instead
For area calculations, use equal-area projection (e.g., Albers)
Split data processing by zone if necessary
solutions.prevention: Plan projection strategy before data collection for multi-zone projects

symptoms.description: Small offset (0-2 meters) between GPS and existing data

causes.description: While often treated as identical, WGS84 and NAD83 can differ by up to 2 meters
indicators: GPS data doesn't quite align with NAD83 control

causes.description: NAD83 has multiple realizations (original, HARN, 2011) that differ

steps: For most applications (< 1m accuracy), treat as equivalent
For high-accuracy work, use explicit transformation
Document datum handling in metadata
solutions.prevention: Specify complete datum information including realization

steps: Identify the NAD83 realization for each dataset
Transform to common realization (preferably NAD83(2011))
Use NGS tools for realization transformations
solutions.prevention: Standardize on NAD83(2011) for new work
